Should Kerry have been denied the Sacrament of communion since is is pro-Choice?
 
 Tell me what you think and visit this site: 
 
 http://http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2004/04/06/politics/main610547.shtml

post_info.post_title: Is Kerry really Catholic with his Pro-Choice views?

I don't think religion belongs in politics. It is wrong and this current administration is so hung up on it. They want people to follow there beliefs.

It isn't my place or anyone else's to lecture a church (catholic or otherwise) on the proper rules of conduct for it's members. John Kerry is free to join any church he wishes and any church is free to withdraw the sacraments from any members they deem unfit. It troubles me when candidates use religious observance as a publicity stunt. Certain members of the Catholic heirarchy are not prepared to allow their Priests and congregations to be used in this fashion and I can't blame them.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Is Kerry really Catholic with his Pro-Choice views?
